page.title: 01Wragby_A General View
page.content: {Wragby}is situated at the{junction {of the A157 and the A158 roads}running from Lincoln to the east coast holiday resorts of Skegness and Mablethorpe.It is also on the route {between Market Rasen and Bardney. A{fairly large village}by Lincolnshire standards,Wragby is the {centre for shopping,entertainment and {religious life of many surrounding {farms and small communities.}The 'old' village is centred around the Market Place,with more recent ribbon development along the arterial roads,plus several small estates.{In {1981,the population was 1071. There is one Primary School,which serves a catchment area of approx.6km. radius.Some local industries exist,but people are increasingly forced to travel to work.Many older people fear Wragby may become a dormitory village.
